availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Weatherford (Colonel in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment )

body.p: Bradfordsville, Kentucky, conductor and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Weatherford. Father of John Weatherford and George Weatherford. Conductor in Brandfordsville in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Bradfordsville, p. 696.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866) 352-53.
Find A Grave, "James Wallace Weatherford, Sr (January 18, 1837-August 17, 1889)," Memorial #44371058, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44371058 (accessed October 25, 2018).
